title: Arcadia
opening: After rescuing Guinevere and Cecilia, Roy headed towards the Nabata Desert, following Sophia’s lead. According to her, the village of Arcadia was located in an oasis hidden in the desert.
However, Arcadia was already under attack by Bern. Roy suspected their aim to be the Dragons that were said to inhabit the village.
Although the Lycia Alliance Army moved as quickly as they could towards Arcadia, a vicious sandstorm stood in their way.

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: Hurry, Fa! There’s a place to hide if you follow this path. Can you make it there?

intro.speaker: Fa
intro.line: But Fa’s tired!

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: Don’t be stubborn. Now go, or else Bern’s soldiers might find us.

intro.speaker: Fa
intro.line: What about Sophia?

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: I don’t know... Maybe she was caught by Bern’s troops.

intro.speaker: Fa
intro.line: If we get caught by Bern, then can we see the outside world?

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: Fa, no. The elders said that we mustn’t communicate with the outside.

intro.speaker: Fa
intro.line: Aww... Please?

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: No. ...But I wonder how Bern found out about our village... Perhaps it has something to do with the ominous energy that Sophia detected from the soldiers...

intro.speaker: Fa
intro.line: What’s wrong?

intro.speaker: Igrene
intro.line: ! I shouldn’t be thinking about such matters now. Fa! Over here, hurry!

intro.speaker: Fa
intro.line: ...Fa wants to see the outside world, too.

intro.speaker: Randy
intro.line: Zeiss! Hasn’t General Narshen arrived yet?

intro.speaker: Zeiss
intro.line: A band of mercenaries and some Dragons have arrived as reinforcements, but General Narshen’s group hasn’t arrived yet.

intro.speaker: Randy
intro.line: What is he thinking? He must know that it’s impossible to conquer the village with a small army like this...

intro.speaker: Randy
intro.line: Anyway, we must inform the king about the Dragons living here. Zeiss, I want you to go to Aquleia and report to King Zephiel.

intro.speaker: Zeiss
intro.line: What shall I say?

intro.speaker: Randy
intro.line: Dragons do indeed inhabit this village. According to a captive, there are also signs of ‘Divine Dragons,’ the most powerful even among Dragons.

intro.speaker: Zeiss
intro.line: Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Randy
intro.line: Make it quick.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Wow... This is some sandstorm.

intro.speaker: Sophia
intro.line: Yes... This sandstorm...has always protected our village from intruders...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: It’s going to be a pain trying to look for a village in this mess. I can’t see three meters ahead... So in which direction should we be moving?

intro.speaker: Sophia
intro.line: Yes... Head to the northeast... But...

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: But?

intro.speaker: Sophia
intro.line: There may be things hidden in the sand...blown around by the sandstorm... Please be careful where you step...

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: Maggie, my dear, did we not see someone head towards the middle of the desert?

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: Yes, Rose, you are most correct.

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: Then, Maggie, it must be true that there is a hidden village around here.

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: Bless my soul, Rose, I believe you are correct.

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: But, my dear Maggie, we don’t want to get lost in the sandstorm, do we?

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: Of course not, Rose. Then we wouldn’t be able to find our way home.

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: Well then, Maggie, do you think that we should pass up the hidden village?

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: My dear Rose, you forget that there are rumors of vast treasures hidden in that village.

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: Well, we certainly don’t want to miss that, do we, Maggie?

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: Of course not, Rose. We can make a lot more money through that than by mugging travelers.

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: But we don’t want to get lost, either, do we, Maggie?

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: My dear Rose, I have an idea. We may follow the people whom we saw heading into the desert earlier.

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: That’s a wonderful idea, Maggie. And once we reach the village, we can thank them by mashing their heads in.

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: Of course, my dear Rose.

battle.speaker: Rose
battle.line: Well then, Maggie, shall we be off?

battle.speaker: Maggie
battle.line: Why certainly, my dear Rose.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: The sandstorm...it stopped.

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: This is our chance, Master Roy! We can see the village clearly now!

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: But so can the enemy. We have to hurry!

battle.speaker: Sophia
battle.line: Something…is glittering in the sand… Oh… A beautiful ring…

boss.speaker: Rose
boss.line: Bless my soul, Maggie… It hurts, does it not…?

boss.speaker: Maggie
boss.line: Hmm… My dear Rose, maybe we were wrong…

boss.speaker: Randy
boss.line: My sword is invincible. Now choose your death. By the blade…or by its light?

boss.speaker: Randy
boss.line: I am glad…that I could meet one as strong as you…before my death.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: That was tough...but we won. Sophia, where are the inhabitants of the village? ...What’s wrong?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: ...The entrance to the temple...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: This door... It looks like it was forced open. What lies inside this temple?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: A spell book... We call it...the Divine Weapon...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Divine Weapon!? There was one here, too? ...Then that must be what Bern was after! In that case, we might be too late...!

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: ...The Divine Weapon is still here...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Really? How can you tell?

end.speaker: Sophia
end.line: It is there... I can feel it...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: All right. Let’s go! We may still be able to stop Bern!

end.speaker: Elder Of Arcadia
end.line: Who are you? How did you enter?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: My name is Roy. I came with Sophia to protect this village.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: With Sophia...? Then it was you who drove off Bern’s soldiers? Oh... Please forgive my impudence. I am the Elder of Arcadia.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Elder... Then are you the Dragon?

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Dragon... They once called me that. But that is a story of a time long since past.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Let me see... The only real Dragon we have is Fa right here.

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Hi...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: This little girl is a Dragon?

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Yes, although she is far from her mature form.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Elder, do you know anything about the Dragons in Bern?

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: What! There are Dragons in Bern?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Yes, we have seen them.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Why...? Dragons do not exist anywhere except here.

end.speaker: Igrene
end.line: Elder, if I may.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: What is it, Igrene?

end.speaker: Igrene
end.line: Sophia said that she could detect evil energy coming from Bern’s troops. That may have something to do with the Dragons Master Roy says he saw in Bern’s army.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Perhaps... But I am too old to detect such energy now.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Energy? What is that?

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Sophia is half Dragon, half human. That gives her the ability to detect the pulses emitted from other Dragons. But because she can’t detect them clearly, she only said that she felt a force...twisted and unnatural.

end.speaker: Igrene
end.line: I think that we should look into it. Elder, if you would allow it, I would like to join Master Roy and look at Bern’s Dragons myself.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: I really do not want to deal with matters of the outside... But this is a time of emergency. Well then, Roy, will you take her?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Certainly.

end.speaker: Igrene
end.line: I am Igrene, the Guardian of Nabata. I have confidence in my skills with the bow. I believe I may be of some help in battle.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: Fa’s going, too!

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: What are you saying? Of course you may not. There is no telling what could happen if your existence were exposed to the world!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Well then, let’s go.

end.speaker: Igrene
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Fa
end.line: ...Fine... Fa will just follow them anyway!
